result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kristen Nicole Samierad
parties.address: 120 E. Aurora Street, Apt. #3, Ironwood, MI 49938

parties.name: Iron County Clerk of Circuit Court

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: For the period of this agreement, the def will comply with the following conditions:  Def shall spend 6 months in ICJ.  Def shall notify Atty Dan Johns of any change of address or phone number within five (5) days of such change.  Def shall have quarterly contact with Atty Dan Johns via phone or letter.  Def shall pay the sum of $65 per quarter to Atty Dan Johns for monitoring this agreement.  Def shall make payment arrangements with the ICCC regarding any fines, court costs, surcharges or atty fees due the Court.  Def shall be tested within thirty (30) days of signing of this agreement for any communicable diseases and results will be provided to the ICDA's office to notify deputy who was spit on.  Def shall pay a total of $538.30 restitution and $48.93 surcharge to the DA's office within thirty (30) days.  Def shall have no negative contact with Law Enforcement.  Def's Bond conditions will not continue.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

Defendant is eligible for Huber and Good Time at the discretion of the Iron County Sheriff's dept.
Concurrent with: Case #16CF52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 1:10 a.m.  Complaint has been served.  Def waives reading and waives right to prelim.  Court accepts waiver.  Recess at 1:18 p.m.  1:25 p.m. BOR:  DA presents DEJ to court.  Calls cases 16CF39, 17CF4, 16CF52.  Per atty Hoffmann, no PLQ filed but has discussed with def and understands DEJ.  Court and attorneys have side bar discussion.  After discussion, information is filed and court proceeds to ARGN.  Atty Hoffmann reviews Info.  Mirrors complaint, waives reading and stands mute.  NG to be entered in 17CF4.  Defense asking court to sign DEJ.  Court grants up to 60 days for def to report for jail sentence.  Discussion held re costs and DNA sample/surcharge.  Only one set of costs/sample/surcharge.  Atty Hoffmann addresses court:  on 16CF39, def pleads NC to Count 1 & 2.  On 16CF52, def pleads to amended county of Misd.  Bailjumping.  Court accepts pleas.  Adjourned at 1:35 p.m.  Per judge after court, def is entitled to Good Time and Huber.  klr

Defendant Kristen Nicole Samierad in court, lodged, with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann appearing via phone means.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Karla Sommer, court reporter.   Case called at 10:53 a.m.  DA calls cases, gives court background re possible bond violation.  Asks for $1,000 cash bond to be set.  Def addresses court.  Attorney Hoffmann addresses court.  Suggest possible additional bond.  DA  renews request to $500 cash.  Court sets additional bond of $1,000 signature with same as previous conditions.  To be scheduled for February 9th at 1:00 p.m. Adj. 11:00 a.m.  klr
